thread.title: Week 5 Fantasy Football: Time to sit Russell Wilson?
thread.title_full: Week 5 Fantasy Football: Time to sit Russell Wilson?

author: Justin Barney & Hays Carlyon
title: Week 5 Fantasy Football: Time to sit Russell Wilson?
text:
Home / Sports Week 5 Fantasy Football: Time to sit Russell Wilson? 
By Justin Barney & Hays Carlyon Sat, Oct 10, 2015 @ 4:01 pm | updated Sat, Oct 10, 2015 @ 6:21 pm Back Photo: 1 of 6 Next AP Seattle Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson, wearing pink for breast cancer awareness, passes during warmups before an NFL football game against the Detroit Lions, Monday, Oct. 5, 2015, in Seattle. (AP Photo/Elaine Thompson) Back Photo: 2 of 6 Next AP Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Sam Bradford (7) passes the ball during the first half of an NFL football game against the Washington Redskins in Landover, Md., Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon) Back Photo: 3 of 6 Next AP Baltimore Ravens running back Justin Forsett (29) runs the ball in an NFL football against the Pittsburgh Steelers, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Don Wright) Back Photo: 4 of 6 Next AP Tennessee Titans wide receiver Kendall Wright (13) plays against the Indianapolis Colts in the second half of an NFL football game Sunday, Sept. 27, 2015, in Nashville, Tenn. The Colts won 35-33. (AP Photo/James Kenney) Back Photo: 5 of 6 Next TNS Cincinnati Bengals running back Jeremy Hill (32) runs for a five-yard touchdown past Kansas City Chiefs strong safety Ron Parker (38) during the third quarter on Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, at Paul Brown Stadium in Cincinnati, Ohio. (David Eulitt/Kansas City Star/TNS) Back Photo: 6 of 6 Next AP FILE - In this Sept. 3, 2015, file photo, Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Martavis Bryant (10) holds the ball before an NFL football preseason game between the Pittsburgh Steelers and the Carolina Panthers in Pittsburgh. Bryant is back at practice after his four-game suspension for violating the NFL's substance abuse policy. (AP Photo/Gene J. Puskar/File) 
THREE TO START 
QB SAM BRADFORD, EAGLES 
Justin Barney: If you drafted Bradford high, he’s killing you. But weekly players and season owners of Bradford should have confidence this week. He finally broke through last week and I love the matchup against the Saints. I like Nick Foles at Green Bay as my No. 2. 
Hays Carlyon: It’s now-or-never this week for Bradford. New Orleans is giving up an average of 26 points a game. I wouldn’t touch him in a weekly format, but if you drafted him in a season league you should give him one last chance. 
RB JUSTIN FORSETT, RAVENS 
JB: He’s playing the Browns, who are as friendly to opposing fantasy backs as DraftKings and FanDuel are to their employees. If Forsett can find the end zone once, he’s probably a 20- to 25-point play. 
HC: I’m not as high on Forsett. The Ravens have no perimeter threats in their passing game, so Cleveland can load up to stop Forsett. And he hasn’t scored this season. 
WR KENDALL WRIGHT, TITANS 
JB: He’s coming off of a bye and has two quality games this season. The Bills are allowing an average of two passing TDs a game. He’s a fringe WR1 this week. 
HC: Good call here. Wright was targeted 12 times in his last outing. He should produce a 100-yard game with a score. 
THREE TO SIT 
QB RUSSELL WILSON, SEAHAWKS 
HC: You probably have to start Wilson in a seasonal league, but I wouldn’t touch him in a weekly format. The Seahawks can’t protect him and that isn’t likely going to change at Cincinnati. Wilson was sacked six times Monday night against Detroit and rarely had a clean pocket. 
JB: Agreed. Over a season, Wilson will prove fantasy value. But he’s a low- to mid- 20s QB this week. Blake Bortles, Alex Smith and Joe Flacco are better plays. 
RB JEREMY HILL, BENGALS 
HC: Sure, he scored three times last week. What are the odds that happens again against Seattle? And his yardage totals merit concern. He gained 39, 21 and 40 yards rushing over the last three games. Giovani Bernard continues to take a large portion of the work. 
JB: That and he’s banged up, too (limited in Thursday’s practice with a knee issue). I’d start Bernard over Hill if you are picking between Cincy backs. 
WR MARTAVIS BRYANT, STEELERS 
HC: I like Bryant’s talent, but I’d be patient with him this week as he returns from a four-game suspension. Mike Vick likely won’t be able to get him the ball deep. Once Ben Roethlisberger is healthy, Bryant will become a must-start each week. The combination of Bryant being rusty and Vick’s skill set leads me away from him. 
JB: Pittsburgh will lean on Le’Veon Bell and lighten Vick’s load. Bryant is a risky pick in any format, even a flex, this week.
